questiontxt: Given a string s, find the length of the longest substring without repeating characters.
constraints: s consists of English letters, digits, symbols and spaces.
howtoapproach:
Approach 1 (Brute Force): Check all substrings and verify if each has unique characters. Time: O(n^3), Space: O(min(n, m)).

Approach 2 (Sliding Window + Hash Set): Expand the window while characters are unique, shrink when duplicates appear. Time: O(n), Space: O(min(n, m)).

Approach 3 (Optimized Sliding Window + Hash Map): Track last seen index of characters to skip directly. Time: O(n), Space: O(min(n, m)). The optimized sliding window using a hash map is the best approach.
